programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jayne Middlemiss presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 19 June 1998. Featuring Five, Pulp, Desree, Silver Sun, Ian Brown, Dario G, Fat Les and Baddiel, Skinner and The Lightning Seeds

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Peter Powell and Stevie Wright present the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 18 September 1986. Featuring Eurythmics, Michael McDonald, Orchestral Manoeuvres in the Dark, Cameo, the Communards and Five Star

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Mark Franklin introduces the edition first shown on September 16 1993. Featuring performances by Motorhead, Pet Shop Boys, Radiohead, Jade, Lenny Kravitz, Chaka Demus and Pliers, Belinda Carlisle and Culture Beat

programme.title: Jimi Hendrix: Electric Church
programme.desc: Documentary follows Jimi Hendrixs seminal performance at the 1970 Atlanta Pop Festival, where he played in front of 300,000 people. Featuring interviews with Hendrix and fellow musicians, including Paul McCartney and Mitch Mitchell

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage of guitarists taken from BBC music shows of the 1970s. Includes electric performances by Carlos Santana, Mark Knopfler, Peter Green and the Edge, and acoustic material by John Martyn, John Renbourn, Bert Jansch and Paco Pena

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: A celebration of 1970s-era axe-men, acoustic virtuosos and thumping riff merchants, in a compilation of guitar-heavy performances from the BBC TV archives. Guitar gods including Jimi Hendrix, Pete Townshend, Peter Green and Johnny Winter are joined by, among others, flamenco maestro Manitas De Plata, bottleneck bluesman Ry Cooder and straight-up rockers AC/DC and Thin Lizzy. Plus, Fleetwood Mac, the Jam and Be Bop Deluxe and Nils Lofgren

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.sub-title: Even More Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Status Quo play Pictures of Matchstick Men on Top of the Pops in 1968, the Who perform Long Live Rock in the Old Grey Whistle Test studio, Dire Straits deliver Tunnel of Love and Lynyrd Skynyrd bring a taste of the American South with Sweet Home Alabama. The programme also features rare performances from George Benson, Leo Kottke, Link Wray and Tom Petty

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: A 1990 edition of Arena made to celebrate the centenary of the mystery writers birth, looking at the life and work of the woman who created Miss Marple, Hercule Poirot and The Mousetrap. The programme looks at how an adolescent Christie read crime reports from newspapers and discussed the ways in which people had died, and also examies the authors mysterious disappearance in 1926

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.sub-title: The Mirror Crackd from Side to Side
programme.desc: A film star arrives from America and throws a summer garden party for the entire village of St Mary Mead - where one of her fans drinks a poisoned cocktail and promptly drops dead. Fortunately, the guest list includes Miss Marple, who immediately sets about tracking down the killer. Feature-length drama, starring Joan Hickson, Claire Bloom and Barry Newman

programme.title: Parkinson
programme.desc: An interview with the actor and raconteur from 1975 in which he regales Michael Parkinson with stories of his early days in Hollywood, from his first-ever movie lines to some hilariously disastrous film publicity stunts

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom learns Margo has been keeping appointments at a mysterious address and immediately leaps to the conclusion that she is having an affair - but doesnt know how to break the news to Jerry. Comedy, starring Richard Briers and Penelope Keith

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Hacker courageously puts his ministerial career in the balance by deciding to inform the prime minister of British arms sales to Italian terrorists. Sir Humphrey launches a frantic damage-limitation exercise to ensure vested interests arent compromised. Political comedy, with Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: Arena

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Kym Marsh and Rav Wilding host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: Fingerprints found at the scene of a burglary are the missing piece of evidence detectives need to convict a man responsible for the murder of the flat owner. When a man is found beaten to death in his own property, police use footprints found around his body to identify one assailant, before putting together their case against his violent accomplice whom they suspect of the killing. Plus, a pair of crooks who burgled an old man and went on a spending spree with his card are caught by CCTV

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The team catches up on one of the shows most unusual and lengthy projects, to undercover a warren of underground Second World War tunnels near Dover. There are also developments in St Johns Wood, one of north Londons most affluent suburbs, as well as a double opportunity at a house in Stoke-on-Trent

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: At Southwell Racecourse in Nottinghamshire, married couple Emma and Zack take on partners Beth and Charlie, assisted by experts Phil Serrell and Roo Irvine respectively. Natasha Raskin Sharp keeps an eye on the proceedings and liaises with auctioneer Richard Winterton about the wisdom of their purchases

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: The part-time sleuth is surprised by a visit from her mother, who is worried about her husbands obsession with a belief that catastrophic events relating to the Cold War are being planned at the British open chess championships. Sister Boniface decides to brush up on her chess skills and enter the tournament. Lorna Watson stars

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley helps a couple with have a substantial budget of £700,000, who are hoping to relocate their family to the Norfolk countryside. For over half a century, Norfolk has also been home to Lotus cars, so while in the county Ginny finds out more about the company heritage before catching a glimpse of the future when the companys latest hypercar is unveiled

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: Dawns life changed drastically when her husband died. The family home in the West Midlands town of Sutton Coldfield, once filled with joy, had begun to overwhelm her with memories. Wanting to downsize and move closer to her daughter, she calls upon the support of presenters Robin Johnson and Izzie Balmer. The duo soon discover transforming tables, pharmaceutical paraphernalia and secret symbols in a house full of collections. Narrated by Christina Trevanion

programme.title: The Answer Run
programme.desc: Jason Manford hosts the fast-paced quiz show in which three couples face a series of 50/50 questions that hurtle down the Answer Run towards them

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which five pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Stephen Mangan

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Clara Amfo and Alex Jones present the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances

programme.title: Paula McIntyres Hamely Kitchen
programme.desc: Paula heads to Kentucky to meet a food writer with Scots-Irish roots, who shows her how to make the perfect buttermilk-fried chicken. She also meets a chef at a farm-to-table restaurant who is putting mountain ingredients such as squash and buttermilk cheese on his menu. Her last stop is to a dairy farm that makes an usual but very tasty buttermilk ice-cream. Paula continues the buttermilk theme in her outdoor mountain kitchen when she makes a buttermilk, lima bean and bacon soup and skillet-cooked biscuits with watermelon, strawberry and coconut jam and whipped buttermilk cream

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Guest panellists Jo Brand, Sam Quek, Bobby Seagull and Joe Thomas join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The semi-finals conclude with five contenders left in the competition. Making the leap to the final stages is no mean feat as the next brief pushes the amateurs to their culinary limit, cooking a dish that celebrates an ingredient they cannot stand. Their chosen ingredients include offal, bananas and liquorice and they need to pull something extraordinary out of the bag as only four will progress. One unfortunate competitor will be kicking themselves as they miss what will surely be the opportunity of a lifetime

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: The recent flare-up causes suspicion and speculation among the remaining honeymooners - and even some of the strongest couples start to feel the strain of stranded life. At the Couples Cove Masquerade Ball, the arrival of an unexpected guest sends shockwaves through the group. Presented by Davina McCall

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Knocked Up
programme.desc: Ambitious journalist Alisons one-night stand with directionless layabout Ben has unexpected consequences when she discovers she is pregnant. However, the unlikely parents-to-be decide to give the relationship a try for their babys sake, forcing Ben to face the challenge of accepting responsibility for the first time in his life. Romantic comedy, starring Seth Rogen, Katherine Heigl and Paul Rudd

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes host a famous family special of the music quiz. Actor Kola Bokinni and his sister DJ Yinka Bokinni, Outnumbered siblings Tyger Drew-Honey and Ramona Marquez, and Stacey Dooley and her partner, actor and dancer Kevin Clifton, compete to name as many songs and artists as possible, with the best pair playing for up to £10,000 in the final round

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Henrique Sá Pessoa and Poppy OToole and special guests Brie Larson and Courtney McBroom. Drinks expert Olly Smith chooses the wine to accompany the studio dishes while Sam Heughan mixes some cocktails

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick visits Europes largest tea plantation, on the banks of the River Fal, bakes a simple yet sumptuous fruited tea loaf and travels to Penzance, where he enjoys an invigorating dip in the UKs largest outdoor seawater lido. He also finds out how Cornwall inspired Charles Dickens and how the county found its way into A Christmas Carol

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott and guests look ahead to the weekends matches, including Manchester United v Chelsea. Plus, news from the lunchtime game between Liverpool and Everton

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Jeanette Kwakye presents coverage of the second session on day eight of the biennial event, held this year at Japan National Stadium in Tokyo. The heptathlon concludes with the 800m at 1.11, with Great Britains Katarina Johnson-Thompson hoping to retain the title. The decathlon has one more event today with the 400m from 1.55, and the action concludes with the mens 800m final at 2.22. Finals also take place in the womens javelin from 1.05 and 5,000m at 1.29. With analysis from Jessica Ennis-Hill and commentary by Steve Cram, Steve Backley, Andrew Cotter, Colin Jackson, Paula Radcliffe and Stef Reid

programme.title: Live Womens Rugby World Cup 2025
programme.desc: England v France (Kick-off 3.30pm). Coverage of the second semi-final, which comes from Ashton Gate in Bristol. The hosts have been in fine form so far, topping their pool and comfortably defeating Scotland 40-8 in the quarter-finals. The French also topped their group, before coming back from 13-0 down at half time against Ireland in the last eight to win 18-13

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman welcome 15 new famous faces, reality stars and content creators to the Strictly ballroom to pair them with their professional partners, while judges Shirley Ballas, Craig Revel Horwood, Motsi Mabuse and Anton Du Beke give their initial thoughts on the couples. Theres also a routine from the reigning champions Chris McCausland and Dianne Buswell and music by Jessie J. The contestants are Alex Kingston, Balvinder Sopal, Dani Dyer, Stefan Dennis, Lewis Cope, Vicky Pattison, Harry Aikines-Aryeetey, Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink, Karen Carney, Chris Robshaw, Ellie Goldstein, Ross King, La Voix, Thomas Skinner and George Clarke

programme.title: Michael McIntyres 25th Year Stand-Up Special
programme.desc: Michael McIntyre celebrates 25 years of stand-up comedy with Macnificent, his latest sold-out show. This performance, recorded at the London Palladium, is filled with the funnymans observations of everyday life, and promises to be a night to remember as he marks a special milestone

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Iain finds himself on his most frightening HART mission yet and is forced to confront his problems when he endangers the life of a team member. Faith is shocked to hear Iains mum died three days ago and Flynn is determined to prove hes a good doctor to Dylan. Nicole decides she wants a future with Ngozi but shocking events stop her from telling her

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Liverpool v Everton at Anfield and Manchester United v Chelsea at Old Trafford. Reigning champions Liverpool will have been expecting three points and bragging rights against their Merseyside neighbours. The Blues and Red Devils were both looking to claim victory after they had to share the spoils in a 1-1 draw at the Theatre of Dreams last term. Plus, Brighton and Hove Albion v Tottenham Hotspur, Burnley v Nottingham Forest, West Ham United v Crystal Palace, Wolverhampton Wanderers v Leeds United and Fulham v Brentford

programme.title: The Football Interview
programme.desc: An interview with Arsenal and England striker Alessia Russo, who scored in the UEFA Euro 2025 final

programme.title: Before I Go to Sleep
programme.desc: A woman who cannot retain her memories following a traumatic accident is contacted by a mysterious neuropsychologist, who offers to help her recover the truth about her condition. As she tries to piece together the events of her past, she begins to fear neither her husband nor the doctor are who they seem to be. Thriller, starring Nicole Kidman, Colin Firth and Mark Strong

programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Athletics: World Championships Highlights
programme.desc: Sarah Mulkerrins presents action from day seven of the biennial event, held this year at Japan National Stadium in Tokyo. Great Britains Katarina Johnson-Thompson started the defence of her heptathlon title with the sprint hurdles, high jump, shot put and 200 metres, and her compatriots Keely Hodgkinson and Georgina Bell were expected to line-up in the womens 800m semi-finals

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: A Celtic farmer is not keen on plans for Hadrians Wall, the identity of Britains top-scoring footballer is revealed, and pioneers of transport sing about their inventions

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May bid to prove that cars can be art by filling a gallery in Middlesbrough with motoring-related works, including a few creations of their own. They also resort to unusual promotional techniques to attract more visitors to their exhibition. Back on the track, Jeremy tests British supercar the Noble M600. Jenson Button drives the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: Comedy, written by and starring Mawaan Rizwan, following one mans quest for attention from anyone wholl give it to him. After splitting up with Guy, Jamma is now between jobs and sleeping on Winnies sofa. However, when he unexpectedly sees Guy for the first time in six months at Isaacs pop-up art exhibition, the spark between the exes is undeniable. To Jamma and Guys surprise a handsome stranger takes a special interest in their relationship status. With Russell Tovey

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: Guys double-booked himself, so asks Jamma to house-sit and let a builder in. Jamma finds Guys manuscript about exes, but on discovering hes not included is sent into a spiral. Isaac comes over to calm Jamma down, but the pair discover Saif pampering himself in the house. Farida arrives with divorce papers and a new showbiz career to show off about. Sitcom, written by and starring Mawaan Rizwan and Russell Tovey

programme.title: Mindhorn
programme.desc: Richard Thorncroft, the star of 1980s sci-fi cop show Mindhorn, sets out to make it in Hollywood, but ends up with his life and career in ruins. Years later, he gets the chance to be a real hero when the police need his help. A dangerous fugitive is on the loose, who believes Detective Mindhorn is real and will only speak to him. Comedy, starring Julian Barratt, Essie Davis and Steve Coogan

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: Angie, Vince and Rosa receive unwanted Mothers Day surprises, while Oly and Santi are faced with a reality they arent ready for. Australian drama, starring Carlos Sanson Jr, Ava Cannon and Nathalie Morris

programme.title: Bump
programme.sub-title: Cant We Just Have a Few Nice Things?
programme.desc: Olys white lie blows up in her face, and Bowie offers a surprising insight into his parents lives. Australian drama, starring Carlos Sanson Jr, Ava Cannon and Nathalie Morris

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May bid to prove that cars can be art by filling a gallery in Middlesbrough with motoring-related works, including a few creations of their own. They also resort to unusual promotional techniques to attract more visitors to their exhibition. Back on the track, Jeremy tests British supercar the Noble M600. Jenson Button drives the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Ibiza: Secrets of the Party Island
programme.desc: Zara McDermott explores the islands economy, with access to luxury clubs, yachts and villas, as well as the local police, undercover detectives and emergency medics. In the first episode, she meets Wayne Lineker, Garys little brother who has made it rich by providing clubbers with a day club pool party

programme.title: Ibiza: Secrets of the Party Island
programme.desc: Zara McDermott gets a closer look at how social media is changing crime. Along with a police team from St Josep, she attends a robbery of a high end villa at knife-point

programme.title: BBC Comedy Short Films

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: Comedy, written by and starring Mawaan Rizwan, following one mans quest for attention from anyone wholl give it to him. After splitting up with Guy, Jamma is now between jobs and sleeping on Winnies sofa. However, when he unexpectedly sees Guy for the first time in six months at Isaacs pop-up art exhibition, the spark between the exes is undeniable. To Jamma and Guys surprise a handsome stranger takes a special interest in their relationship status. With Russell Tovey

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: Guys double-booked himself, so asks Jamma to house-sit and let a builder in. Jamma finds Guys manuscript about exes, but on discovering hes not included is sent into a spiral. Sitcom, written by and starring Mawaan Rizwan and Russell Tovey

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Race The Beast/Surprise, Its Spring/The Missing Mushlet/The Hero Trap
programme.desc: Mush-Mush and his friends are determined to win the bark sledge race, but their essential fourth team member drops out. / Puff doesn’t like change much. And with spring about to burst forth and all the changes spring brings, he is puffing out nervous fog which is blanketing the whole of Mushton. / So Mushpie can take a break, Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit offer to look after the Mushies, assuring her that everything will be fine. / The Mushlets love Mush-Mush’s heroic stories. But when they demand to see him actually do something heroic, Mush-Mush feels he can’t back out.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: The Hero Trap/Bird Call/Let It Bee/The Staff Of Wisdom/The Snake Dance/Grasshopper Chep
programme.desc: The Mushlets love Mush-Mush’s heroic stories. But when they demand to see him actually do something heroic, Mush-Mush feels he can’t back out. / Chanterelle has built a whistle that can reproduce the most beautiful sound of the forest: the one of the Nightingale. / Wanting to rush off to climb Mush Mountain, Mush-Mush is in a hurry checking nectar level in flowers – a job that takes time and care. / Mush-Mush is amazed by the way Mushpot uses his staff of wisdom and how awesome it makes him look. / When Mush-Mush and Chep lose Lilit’s flying disc down a snake tunnel, he is confident he can get it back. / All the Mushables have fun zooming down a long mudslide except Chep, who just cant get up the courage to do it.

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.sub-title: Mass Control / Bear Under Control / Popcorn Party...
programme.desc: .../ Dancing with the Bears / Role Change / Lemming Tonic / Bear Itch / Thirst Quencher => Grizzy discovers a gadget that controls various functions in the cabin. He will finally be able to rid of the Lemmings without even leaving the couch! / Grizzy turns the fridge into a safe. / The Lemmings have invented a new popcorn game which consists of throwing popcorn and catching it with their mouths. / Grizzy wants to learn to dance the mambo to please the she-bear hes in love with, for she truly adores this rhythm. / After receiving a terrible blow over the head Grizzy is no longer the same: he thinks hes a rodent! He tries to get the gang to adopt him. / Grizzy battles with the Lemmings over the couch. / Grizzy discovers that the frenzied break dance the Lemmings are doing is actually due to the fleas they are infested with. / Grizzy is thirsty but the river bed has dried up.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Puffs Perfect Picnic/Run, Mushpie, Run/Watch the Storm/Lightning Bark/Special Delivery

Only Puff isn’t comfortable in that role. / Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit notice that Mushpie seems in great shape lately. They want to feel as great as she does and try to discover her secret. / When Chep asks Mush-Mush and Lilit to go storm-watching and they refuse, Lilit feels bad and convinces Mush-Mush to join their friend. / Fung and Miff have come across a rare piece of bark struck by lightning. / Chep knows so many things about nature that Mush-Mush and Lilit are confident he’s not far from being an expert like Mushpot.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The shrinks radio show survives a stern focus-group test, but he cannot help wondering why one of the members was less impressed than the others. The saga of the scissor-lift cabin continues, as George and Will Hardie get to grips with some serious weight issues

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are in Surrey, where space is a key requirement for their house-hunting families. Elise and Elliot have already seen the house they love but its way over budget, leaving Kirstie the tricky task of finding something cheaper that matches their dream home. Phil Spencer is with Kim and Ralph, who, along with their two children under five, are bursting out of Kims two-bedroom starter flat. They desperately want a taste of the space they grew up with in Zimbabwe - but close to their extended family in Horley

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer head to Strathaven, Lanarkshire to help Frank and Wilma decide whether to sell their four-bedroom family home or invest in it to make it work for them. Frank is firmly on Team Love It, having raised their two children there, he is convinced they still have many happy years to come in the house, while Wilma is ready to sell now that their kids have flown the nest. Kirstie grapples with a poorly placed conservatory and a kitchen diner that struggles to fit the extend ed family in as she creates a plan to renovate while Phil is put through his paces trying to convince Frank to swap suburban life for sea views

programme.title: Worst House on the Street
programme.desc: Carl and Lynn have bought a bungalow in Leeds, in the hope of being mortgage-free for retirement. But they need all the help they can get from Stuart and Scarlette Douglas to turn it around quickly so that they can move in

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The bakers are hoping for a Hollywood handshake this week as they tackle bread, the steely-eyed judges speciality. They begin by putting their stamp on a pull-apart monkey bread in the signature challenge, before being asked to make a sticky, messy, fast food technical. For the showstopper, they serve up sweet bread in tiers. Sadly, for one baker, this will be their last day in the tent. Who will be dusting themselves off and hanging up their apron?

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Formula 1
programme.sub-title: Formula 1 Azerbaijan Grand Prix Qualifying Highlights
programme.desc: Steve Jones presents action from the battle for grid positions for the 17th round of the season from the Baku City Circuit. Charles Leclerc claimed the pole position on the starting grid at last years race, clocking the fastest lap time in both the first and third qualifying sessions. His former Ferrari teammate Carlos Sainz Jr was third fastest in qualifying, but he was joined on the front row by McLarens Oscar Piastri, who was second quickest. With analysis from Billy Monger and Alice Powell

programme.title: Britains Railway Empire in Colour
programme.desc: Investigating how the rail compartment fascinated the Victorians as a place of intrigue and romance. As the 20th century dawned, railways continued to expand across the Empire. The Trans-Australia Railway was built. In South Africa, the railways played a key role in the Boer War and a battle for an armoured train made Winston Churchill famous. Railways were forced to adapt to world events - transporting soldiers in two World Wars and employing women in key roles for the first time. Hundreds of black and white photographs and reels of film survive from those tumultuous times. The latest technology restores the archive, bringing the story of rail back to life

programme.title: The Creator

programme.title: Peppermint

Withdrawing from society, this mild-mannered mother goes off grid - and while grieving for the loss of her loved ones, she turns herself into a one-woman killing machine, before returning from the shadows to exact her revenge. Thriller, starring Jennifer Garner, Jeff Hephner and Juan Pablo Raba

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes

programme.desc: Documentary following life during winter in the Yorkshire Dales and the Lake District. In Grasmere, father-and-son shepherding team Peter and Robert Bland have worked Herdwick sheep all their lives. Theyre heading up the fell, like they do every season, to gather their sheep. This time, the flock must be brought to the farm for pregnancy testing, to see how busy spring will be. Not all journeys to school are the same, and in Hawes in the rural Yorkshire Dales, the local bus service goes above and beyond to ensure all pupils get to school, no matter where they live. Narrated by Ian McMillan

programme.desc: Ben travels to Southeast Asia, meeting entrepreneur Niall who now helps the countrys street-dogs after trading in his previous career. programme.desc: Ben heads to northern England to stay with a man who traded in his house for a life on the road, travelling the UK and joining a community of full-time nomads who survive off the grid. They travel to the coastline to stay overnight on the beach, go on a road trip and meet up with Pauls nomadic community. programme.title: Ben Fogle: New Lives in the Wild
programme.desc: Ben visits Sri Lanka to stay with Naveen and Anke at their home in the countrys highlands. They discuss why they moved away from civilisation, the struggles they had settling into their new lives and if they mean to entirely sever their ties with the outside world. Ben makes himself useful fixing a burst pipe, rendering walls with cow dung and making supply trips to a town

programme.title: Susan Calmans Grand Day Out
programme.desc: Susan heads to the lush county of Cumbria. Spanning the Lake District and North Pennines, this area looks like it is straight out of a storybook. Susan meets a storyteller laureate, before taking to the largest lake in England on the ideal boat for a Swallows and Amazons-style adventure

programme.title: Susan Calmans Grand Day Out
programme.desc: The comedian goes on a trip to the north-east corner of England, taking in the Pennines and Northumberland coast. Susan enjoys a stretch of Heritage Coast and the rolling countryside of the North Pennines. She also explores the Northumberland National Park

programme.title: Secret Life of the Forest
programme.desc: Its the height of summer in Dalby and Cropton Forests and the inhabitants are making the most of the abundance the warm weather provides. The young beaver kits bond with the rest of the family as they learn how to groom and chew through bark, two important skills they need to master. This episode also looks back at the history of the Lumberjills, the affectionate name given to the women who worked in the forest during the Second World War as part of the womens Timber Corps

programme.title: Secret Life of the Forest
programme.desc: With autumn well on its way, much of the wildlife in Dalby and Cropton Forests prepares for the new season and all that it brings. Over at the beaver pond, ecologist Cath is keeping a close eye on the family, as the older siblings begin to show signs of causing conflict in the wider group. Apprentice forester Holly masters using a chainsaw as the team cut down trees that could be risky to the public

programme.title: Michael Portillo in Andalucia
programme.desc: Michael visits Cordoba, focusing on the history of different civilisations that have influenced what it is to be Andalucian today, before entering Mesquita, considered to be one of the worlds greatest Islamic buildings. He also meets a family who use an ancient Roman technique to keep their courtyard cool and helps out in a local restaurant, where he learns how certain dishes have shaped the culture

programme.title: Michael Palin in Venezuela
programme.desc: Michael explores the country, a huge and once oil-rich nation that has been called the most dangerous in South America, which contrasts with its beautiful scenery. In this edition, Michael finds investigative reporter Ana Vanessa Herrero to hear about the shock re-election of Nicolás Maduro as President and the countrys slide into totalitarian rule

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the days headlines from around the world

programme.title: The Kings Grandchildren: Growing Up Rich
programme.desc: As proud grandparents, King Charles and Queen Camilla have 10 grandchildren between them, with some being princes and princesses while others have more normal existences outside the media spotlight. This programme examines the lives of the royal grandchildren and looks at how the King and Queen might navigate the complex dynamics of this very modern family

programme.title: Secrets of the Royal Palaces
programme.desc: The history of Hampton Courts Great Hall, a huge dining area built by more than 400 stonemasons, bricklayers, carpenters, joiners and labourers that was also used by Henry VIII to keep an eye on his household. Plus, a look at the 2002 Golden Jubilee Party, which was held in the grounds of Buckingham Palace and is considered to have changed the publics perception of monarchy

programme.title: Kate: Judge My Work, Not My Clothes
programme.desc: Since the Princess of Wales married into the royal family the press has been obsessed by what she wears and how she looks, but in February an article suggested she would prefer the world to focus on the substance of her work rather than her style. This documentary takes a look at how the Princess of Wales passion for fashion and dedication to the causes she supports have been interlinked right from the start, and explores whether the medias obsession with her wardrobe has overshadowed the incredible work she does

programme.title: When TV Goes Horribly Wrong
programme.desc: Tony Blackburn narrates a compilation of on-air disasters from the 1960s, including Doris Days blouse bursting open unexpectedly and a candid interview with Muhammad Ali. Mickey Rooney has a bad day at the office plugging his short-lived sitcom, and there are bloopers from TV favourites including The Lucy Show, Gunsmoke and Star Trek. Contributors include Amanda Barrie, Freddie Parrot Face Davies, Simon Williams, Erin Murphy and Mark Lester

programme.title: Traffic Cops: Pursuit Squad One
programme.desc: Following the countrys highly trained police bikers, the UKs fastest responders who are always at the ready to race at top speed to save lives and catch suspects on the run. Near the end of a busy Bank Holiday weekend, biker cop Paul Buckley is called to a serious crash involving a car and motorbike in the North Yorkshire countryside. Tragically, the biker has died. Paul and colleagues begin piecing together how and why the collision occurred to work out if either the driver or rider could be to blame. Near York, after a disqualified driver fails to stop for police and goes off road and on the run, biker cop Paddy Green hunts down the runaway driver

programme.title: Jason Watkins and Lady Jane Grey: A Tower of London Special
programme.desc: The actor tries to find the truth behind two family mysteries, with historian Tracy Borman helping discover whether he is related to John Brydges, the royal courtier responsible for overseeing the imprisonment and execution of Lady Jane Grey, Englands shortest-reigning queen. According to family legend, Jason could also be connected to another, even more famous figure, renowned Georgian author Jane Austen

Will their risky choices and haute cuisine appeal to their guests?

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa lets her imagination run wild when she makes a new friend and they create a magical kingdom together called Equalia, complete with characters and plotlines. But they find themselves facing a nightmare when the boundaries between reality and fantasy become blurred. With the voice of Emily Blunt

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer is distressed to learn that Lenny and Carl fixed the result of a senior class presidential election, which he lost in high school - leading him to speculate on how his life would have changed for the better had he won the ballot

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mr Burns asks the family to look after his mansion while he books himself into a clinic for a complete check-up - but with Homer in charge, things are hardly likely to run smoothly. Featuring the guest voice of Britney Spears

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer and Bart transform a losing racehorse into a champion - much to the dismay of rival jockeys, who soon start threatening dire reprisals. With the voices of Randy Bachman and Fred Turner

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Maude Flanders is killed in a tragic accident at the racetrack, leaving Ned facing a lonely old age - so unlikely matchmaker Homer volunteers to help him get back on to the dating scene. With the guest voice of Shawn Colvin

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer follows the Rev Lovejoys advice and becomes a missionary on a remote Pacific island, where he soon corrupts the innocent natives by press-ganging them into building a casino. With the guest voice of Betty White

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Moe decides to change his down-at-heel image by undergoing plastic surgery - and transforms himself so radically that he ends up getting a job as an actor in a soap opera. Unfortunately, he makes the mistake of sneaking Homer onto the set for a guest appearance, and ends up getting fired

programme.title: Sister Act
programme.desc: Nightclub singer Deloris Van Cartier agrees to testify against her gangster boyfriend after witnessing a murder. Placed in protective custody by the authorities, she is less than pleased to discover she is expected to pose as chaste nun Sister Mary Clarence in a convent. Comedy, starring Whoopi Goldberg, Harvey Keitel, Maggie Smith, Bill Nunn and Kathy Najimy

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: Some of Britains favourite personalities hit the sofa to share their opinions of First Dates, Squid Game, Olivia Attwood: The Price of Perfection, Match Me Abroad, Building the Band and BBC News reports on the game of bingo and the return of Oasis

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics review Coronation Street, Married at First Sight UK, Welcome to Wrexham, The Good Ship Murder and Nadiyas Simple Spices. Also, Fletchers Family Farm, Susan Calmans Grand Day Out and a This Morning feature on bed bugs. From October 2023

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows they have been watching during the week. Programmes being appraised include Planet Earth III, Mamma Mia! I Have a Dream, Surviving Paradise, Uncanny, Celebrity Race Across the World and Crack Addicts. Plus, they share their thoughts on news coverage of the two recent by-elections and the death of Bobby Charlton

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Hoping to meet someone feral, but not too feral, divorcee Jo is introduced to pub landlord Sam. They bond over Tank Girl and Jo soon feels comfortable enough to speak about her alopecia. Fiftysomething voice-over artist Ingrid is paired with 57-year-old cinema operator Simon and they quickly connect over a shared passion for film. Marina is a 28-year-old jewellery designer searching for a Christian who believes in chastity before marriage. Twenty-nine-year-old barber Costa is a man of faith who says grace before they eat. Has Marina found her miracle man?

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Shaven-headed aspiring rapper Matt is romantically minded enough to present a bouquet of flowers to his date, music producer Breda. Dynamic grandmother Karen sets out to give retired teacher Jims dating game a boost, while Abbie is matched with Matt, who struggles with confidence and battles to make an order in restaurants. Abbie warms up her tongue-tied date - before dropping a bombshell

programme.title: Mandy
programme.desc: A couple whose daughter was born deaf and mute decide to enrol her in a special class in the hope that she might learn to speak. The difficulties they face in raising their child expose the tensions within their marriage. Drama based on the novel The Day Is Ours by Hilda Lewis, starring Phyllis Calvert, Jack Hawkins, Mandy Miller and Terence Morgan

programme.title: Arizona Raiders
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the American Civil War, two Confederate soldiers are offered a way out of jail. Their former comrades-in-arms are now a gang of bandits terrorising Arizona, and the two prisoners are sent to infiltrate the group and bring them to justice. Western, starring Audie Murphy, Buster Crabbe, Ben Cooper and Gloria Talbott

programme.title: All the Kings Men
programme.desc: A small-town senator wins popular support by railing against the corruption of the political establishment and vowing to defend the interests of ordinary working people. However, once in office, he succumbs to greed as readily as those he once so virulently condemned. Political drama, starring Broderick Crawford, Joanne Dru, John Ireland and Mercedes McCambridge

programme.title: The Black Swan
programme.desc: Notorious pirate Henry Morgan is made governor of Jamaica, and offers other buccaneers the choice of giving up their lawless ways or facing justice. Two rogues refuse to toe the line, so Morgans trusted ally James Waring is sent to track them down, but has other things on his mind - namely winning the daughter of the previous governor away from her duplicitous fiance. High-seas adventure, with Tyrone Power, Laird Cregar, George Sanders, Maureen OHara and Anthony Quinn

programme.title: The Eagle
programme.desc: A Roman centurion seeks to restore his fathers honour by recovering the standard of a legion that disappeared. Accompanied by his British slave, he makes a dangerous journey north of Hadrians Wall into the Scottish Highlands, territory occupied by hostile tribes. Action adventure, starring Channing Tatum, Jamie Bell, Mark Strong and Donald Sutherland

programme.title: Legion
programme.desc: The Archangel Michael turns his back on Heaven and travels to a small-town diner to protect a pregnant waitress and her unborn child from Gods wrath. Action fantasy, starring Paul Bettany, Dennis Quaid, Lucas Black, Tyrese Gibson, Adrianne Palicki and Willa Holland

programme.title: Morbius
programme.desc: Dangerously ill with a rare blood disorder, and determined to save others suffering his same fate, biochemist Dr Michael Morbius attempts a desperate gamble. However, what at first appears to be a radical success soon reveals itself to be a remedy potentially worse than the disease, when he develops a form of vampirism. Comic-book adventure, starring Jared Leto, Matt Smith, Adria Arjona and Jared Harris

programme.title: The Hate U Give
programme.desc: Starr Carter lives in two worlds - the poor, black neighbourhood where she resides and the mostly white prep school she attends. When she witnesses the fatal shooting of her childhood friend by a policeman, Starr must find her voice and stand up for whats right. Drama, starring Amandla Stenberg, Regina Hall and Russell Hornsby

programme.title: Wonder Park
programme.desc: June, a science-loving little girl, and her mother spend hours playing with stuffed animals and other toys, fashioning a world of imagination connected to a fabulous theme park. When Junes mom is diagnosed with a life-threatening illness and has to go away for treatment, June finds a real version of her theme park. Animated family adventure, with the voices of Mila Kunis, Jennifer Garner and Kenan Thompson

programme.title: Born Free
programme.desc: Oscar-winning fact-based drama chronicling the lives of game wardens Joy and George Adamson, who adopted an orphaned lion cub in Kenya and trained the animal to survive in the wild so that one day it might return to its natural habitat. Starring Virginia McKenna, Bill Travers and Geoffrey Keen

programme.title: Babe: Pig in the City
programme.desc: The pig and his farmyard pals take a trip to the big city, where their curiosity and love of adventure lands them in trouble, leaving the courageous Babe to find a way to save his chums from danger. Family comedy sequel, starring Magda Szubanski, Mickey Rooney and James Cromwell, and featuring the voice of Elizabeth Daily as Babe

programme.title: The Devil Wears Prada
programme.desc: A woman with dreams of becoming a journalist takes a job as assistant to the editor of a prestigious fashion magazine - a position that should guarantee a bright future if she succeeds. Unfortunately, she has just signed up to work for the boss from hell, whose cruel personality and outrageous demands make her life a nightmare. Comedy drama, with Meryl Streep, Anne Hathaway, Stanley Tucci and Emily Blunt

programme.title: Jumanji: The Next Level
programme.desc: Players of Jumanji return, but as they attempt to rescue one of their own, they will have to brave parts unknown from arid deserts to snowy mountains, to escape the worlds most dangerous game. Director Jake Kasdans fantasy adventure sequel to his 2017 rebooted hit Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle, starring Dwayne Johnson, Karen Gillan, Kevin Hart and Jack Black

programme.title: The Mechanic
programme.desc: A professional hitman lets his emotional detachment slip when his mentor is murdered, and puts his deadly skills to the task of getting revenge. The solitary assassin finds an ally in his teachers son, who also yearns for vengeance and persuades the killer to teach him the tricks of the trade. Action thriller remake, starring Jason Statham, Ben Foster and Donald Sutherland.

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: New York cop John McClane visits Los Angeles to see his family over the Christmas holiday. Stopping off at his wifes place of work, he realises armed men have taken over the building and are holding the corporations staff to ransom - and only he has the ability to fight back. Action thriller, starring Bruce Willis, Alan Rickman and Bonnie Bedelia

programme.title: Ravenous
programme.desc: A mysterious Scotsman regales a group of 19th-century American soldiers with stomach-churning tales of cannibalism. As the troops trek across the mountains in search of evidence to support his claims, it becomes obvious the shifty Scot is hiding a secret. Horror, starring Guy Pearce, Robert Carlyle, David Arquette, Jeremy Davies and Jeffrey Jones

programme.title: The New Avengers
programme.desc: An unknown enemy steals a new sleeping gas and unleashes it over London, leaving the citys banks and jewellery shops vulnerable to looting. Espionage adventure, starring Patrick Macnee, Gareth Hunt and Joanna Lumley

programme.title: The Rock
programme.desc: A renegade general and his crack team of mercenaries take over the abandoned fortress prison of Alcatraz and threaten San Francisco with toxic nerve-gas rockets to extort a massive ransom. To break their stranglehold on the city, the FBI sends in a chemical weapons expert and a jailed SAS veteran, chosen because he is the only man to have ever escaped from the infamous penitentiary. Action thriller, with Sean Connery, Nicolas Cage and Ed Harris

programme.title: Hell Is for Heroes
programme.desc: A rebellious soldier defies orders to lead two men on a secret attack on a German pillbox, but his mission fails and the other two soldiers are killed. Court-martialled for his actions, he remains convinced his plan was sound and ignores the sentence to make a second attempt at destroying the emplacement. Second World War adventure, with Steve McQueen, James Coburn and Bobby Darin

programme.title: The High Chaparral

programme.title: Demetrius and the Gladiators
programme.desc: A Greek slave is forced into the gladiatorial service when he defends an elderly merchant from the attack of a sadistic centurion. But he also has the hallowed robe of Christ - which makes him the target of Emperor Caligula and the treacherous Messalina, because they believe it has special powers. However, the reluctant gladiator does not intend to give it up to them. Historical drama, starring Victor Mature, Susan Hayward, Michael Rennie and Debra Paget

programme.title: Forty Guns
programme.desc: A despotic Arizona landowner, who uses a band of hired gunmen to dominate her territory, becomes attracted to a determined US marshal sent to restore order. The lawman has renounced violence, but when tragedy strikes on the day of his wedding, he takes up arms once again. Western, starring Barbara Stanwyck, with Barry OSullivan and Dean Jagger

programme.title: Stagecoach
programme.desc: A fugitive from justice joins a motley assortment of beleaguered stagecoach passengers travelling to Lordsburg through hostile territory. John Fords western, starring John Wayne, Claire Trevor, Andy Devine and John Carradine

programme.title: The Undefeated
programme.desc: A veteran Union officer crosses paths again with a former Confederate enemy years after the end of the Civil War - and their past animosity resurfaces. However, when a Mexican general takes the ex-Confederate and his men hostage, the old Union soldier debates whether to surrender his herd of horses by way of ransom. programme.title: The Sweetest Christmas
programme.desc: Kylie, a struggling pastry chef, discovers she has secured a place in the finals of the American Gingerbread Competition. Spotting a chance to raise her profile - and perhaps jumpstart business at her new cafe - she enters, but her chances of winning are quickly slashed when her oven breaks down right before the contest. Determined to remain in the running, she appeals to her old boyfriend Nick, who gave up his education to take over his family pizzeria. He agrees to let her use his kitchens industrial ovens to craft her gingerbread delicacies, and as they pair work together, a familiar spark rekindles their old flame. Festive romance, starring Lacey Chabert and Lea Coco

programme.sub-title: Ill Be Waving as You Drive Away - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Just as Mary falls in love with newcomer Seth Barton, her eyesight begins to worsen. Charles takes her to an optometrist, but the news is not good - Marys vision cannot be saved and she will soon go blind. In denial, Charles does not tell his daughter until she finds to her horror she is completely blind. Mary becomes very bitter over her predicament and having to rely on others for basic needs. Drama, starring Michael Landon

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.sub-title: Ill Be Waving as You Drive Away - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mary is sent to a blind school in Iowa, where she meets Adam Kendall. She refuses to accept his help at first, but he eventually helps her learn to deal with her blindness. When Adam encourages Mary before her return to Walnut Grove, he says a key line that serves as the title of this episode. Meanwhile, the town of Walnut Grove faces bankruptcy as its citizens prepare to move out

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Donna is stunned by Marlons revelation. She lashes out at Eli and tells him to get out of her life, before telling Marlon their marriage is over.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Emily inadvertently locks Laurel in the church, where she goes into labour with only Shadrach on hand to help. Diane argues with Jack before kissing Billy in the Woolpack.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Fiz is mortified by Johns reaction to their kiss, only to get an even bigger surprise when Kirk catches up with her. Steve has his hopes of a romantic evening dashed.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Michelle looks forward to another date with Steve, only to discover hes brought Amy along. Kirk is distraught after being dumped, while Claire takes decisive action against the Mortons.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The curmudgeonly GP struggles to come to terms with his new role as a father, having planned to resume his career as a consultant in London before the arrival of his and Louisas as-yet unnamed son. To make matters worse, he begins to have serious doubts about the competency of his replacement Dr Di Dibbs when she misdiagnoses a patient as well as herself. Martin is then dealt a devastating personal blow after hearing his aunt Joan has died. Starring Martin Clunes, Joanna Scanlan and Caroline Catz

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The GP returns to his former post at the surgery after the departure of Dr Dibbs, agreeing to stay until a replacement is found. He persuades a reluctant Louisa to move into his house so he can help raise their son, and suggests they could all move to London together in the future. Martin then delivers the eulogy at his aunt Joans funeral and speaks to her sister Ruth, who proves to be just as cantankerous as he is. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz, with Eileen Atkins

programme.title: The Royal
programme.sub-title: Its Whats on the Inside That Counts
programme.desc: New recruit Thelma Parker catches the eye of Harper, but proves to be less popular with the rest of the team, and an injured boxer causes concern for the staff at the hospital. Dr Weatherill finds herself caught in an ethical battle when the parents of a dangerously ill baby refuse treatment, while Samantha receives unwanted news. Medical drama starring John Axon, Amy Robbins, Anna Madeley and Barbara Marten

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Mike attracts the unwanted attentions of a famous romantic novelist who has moved to the area in search of literary inspiration, while borstal boys on a work placement cause mayhem in the village. Greengrass helps a would-be councillors election campaign - and has no qualms about playing dirty to foil rival candidate Blaketons bid for office. Starring Jason Durr and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Mike plans to marry Jackie in secret, but the search for an armed train robber threatens to keep him from getting to the church on time. Meanwhile, Greengrass faces another kind of crisis _ his charismatic sister Isabelle turns up in Aidensfield, and proves to be more than a match for him. Judy Cornwell guest stars

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Diane packs her bags after Billy tells her to choose between him and Jack. New mum Laurel is upset to learn her parents wont be visiting, while Donna moves back into Tall Trees.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Billy risks returning to prison by stealing a car to follow Diane, while Lexi gets an invitation to a jewellery sale at Home Farm. Jimmy notices tension between Kelly and Carrie.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Fire attacks the Peacock home and Claire is knocked unconscious as she rushes to save Freddie. Leannes cover may be blown when Dev asks her to find him a Spanish villa.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Deirdre visits Ken to tell him how much he still means to her - but he wants to make a new start with Daniel. Liam tries to get to the bottom of Leanne and Pauls mutual dislike.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: New receptionist Morwenna Newcross (Jessica Ransom) gets off to a bad start after arriving late on her first day, and her hyperactive behaviour leads Martin to believe she is high on drugs. Ruth tries to deal with an intruder on the farm who has stolen the hub caps from her car, and the sleepless nights begin to take their toll on Martin and Louisa, who are running out of ways to comfort their constantly wailing baby. Guest starring Andrew-Lee Potts (Primeval)

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisas hippie mother Eleanor (Louise Jameson) arrives in the village, immediately taking over Martins kitchen to prepare a herbal tonic, which she later gives to the baby to stop his crying. A culinary rivalry develops between Bert and Mark Bridge, the landlord of the Crab and Lobster pub, at Portwenn Fun Day, with both keen to take advantage of the event by providing food for the spectators

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Blaketons attempts to crack down on crime meet with a violent response and Ginas interest is aroused by a mysterious visitor. Greengrass has his eye on the main chance as usual - he reckons there is big money to be made by attracting tourists to Aidensfield and decides to rewrite local history to make the village more interesting. Derek Fowlds, Tricia Penrose and Bill Maynard star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Mike makes a shocking discovery about Jackie, forcing him to re-evaluate his marriage almost before it has begun, while unlikely undertaker Greengrass applies his ingenuity to the task of arranging a funeral with a difference. Rural drama, starring Jason Durr, Fiona Dolman and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Joyce Barnaby swerves off the road into a ditch, convinced she has hit someone, but nobody is found injured and Tom thinks she has imagined it. However, when a local historian discovers the body of a librarian in a nearby cemetery, Joyce blames herself for the mans death, leading her husband into a spooky investigation to find the real killer on the loose in the haunted village of March Magna. Guest starring Danny Webb (The Bill), with John Nettles, Jason Hughes and Jane Wymark

programme.title: Law and Order: UK
programme.desc: When a series of shootings claims one of their own, Ronnie and Joe have little time to grieve - they must solve the case before the killer reaches their next target on a hit list that includes CPS director Henry Sharpe. It gradually becomes apparent that the common thread connecting all the names is the case of Mark Glendon, convicted of the murder of his wife four years earlier. Although hes still in custody, a retrial is imminent, putting pressure on the team to catch the murderer before the jury delivers its verdict

programme.title: Law and Order: UK
programme.desc: Still reeling from the death of one of their own, Ronnie and Joe face a new challenge when an innocent young mum is fatally stabbed in a busy marketplace, just as a senior police officer publicly pledges to crack down on knife crime. Under pressure from all sides, the pair struggle to gather evidence against the youth they think is responsible, and the suspects unintentional confession appears to bring the case to a close. However, Ronnie is the only person who hears the admission, and it proves difficult getting anyone to believe him. With the detectives honesty cast into doubt and his effectiveness questioned at every turn, is this the end of his career? With Tony Gardner, Sharon Small and Colin Salmon

programme.title: Agatha Christies Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective begins to suspect something is amiss when he visits one of his favoured haunts in London for dinner and discovers a fellow regular has dramatically changed his diet. Down in Brighton, elderly Anthony Gascoigne lies dying while his estranged twin brother Henry falls to his death - but nobody is sure whether the man was deliberately pushed. Bizarrely, the key to the riddle seems to lie in a blackberry pie. David Suchet stars in the title role, with Philip Jackson, Hugh Fraser and Pauline Moran

programme.title: Joanna Lumleys Home Sweet Home - Travels in My Own Land
programme.desc: After a lifetime of travels that have taken her across the globe, Joanna Lumley is making her most personal journey yet. The final episode takes Joanna from North Wales to St Michaels Mount and the West Country, ending in her home city of London

programme.sub-title: Cast Not Your Pearls Before Swine - Part One

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: Cast Not Your Pearls Before Swine - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Roger returns to Liverpool, while Pop discovers Ediths new boyfriend George is a con-artist defrauding the ministry - and resolves to teach him a lesson. David Jason stars

programme.title: Agatha Christies Marple
programme.desc: The sleuth helps an old friend find refuge at country house Greenshaws Folly, but a sinister shadow falls over the strange buildings various inhabitants and a murderer strikes. Miss Marple uncovers secrets from the past about Miss Greenshaw as a dangerous storm gathers and the bodies start to pile up. Julia McKenzie heads an all-star cast that includes Jim Moir (better known as Vic Reeves), Kimberley Nixon, Fiona Shaw, Robert Glenister, Julia Sawalha, Judy Parfitt and Matt Willis (formerly of pop group Busted)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A murder at a remote cottage in Northumberland takes DCI Vera Stanhope back to a place full of childhood memories and reminds her of an unsolved case from earlier in her career. Delving into the local politics surrounding a controversial proposal to dig a quarry, she and her team find motives in the unlikeliest of places - until they realise that the truth could be hidden within the land itself. Detective drama, adapted from Ann Cleeves novel The Crow Trap, guest starring Daniela Nardini (This Life) alongside Brenda Blethyn

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Joyce Barnaby swerves off the road into a ditch, convinced she has hit someone, but nobody is found injured and Tom thinks she has imagined it. However, when a local historian discovers the body of a librarian in a nearby cemetery, Joyce blames herself for the mans death, leading her husband into a spooky investigation to find the real killer on the loose in the haunted village of March Magna. Guest starring Danny Webb (The Bill), with John Nettles, Jason Hughes and Jane Wymark

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the owners of Karras Games gather for a murder mystery weekend, the immersive experience takes a puzzling twist when a killer strikes for real. Gathering at Hulton Manor, a sprawling edifice on its own island, a storm rages outside adding to the immersive experience of the fictional murder playing out in front of them, until one of them tumbles down the stairs, and is impaled by a life-size Egyptian figure - killing him for real

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates when the body of a wildlife ranger is found on a remote island off the coast of Northumberland. Her death is at first assumed to be an accident, since she was alone on the island when she died, but marks on the body seem to point to murder. As Vera delves into the dead womans personal life, she uncovers dark secrets and old resentments

programme.title: Shetland
programme.desc: Perez interviews Andrea Doyle. Initially petulant, she quickly becomes scared when he explains the charges against her, and reluctantly agrees to show him the safe house. The detectives are horrified to discover Nikkis body dumped in the garden of the property, wrapped in bin liners. A distraught Olivia comes dangerously close to driving herself and Jamie Hayes off the edge of a cliff, while a hungover Duncan makes a shocking discovery when he wakes up on the beach. Douglas Henshall and Therese Bradley star

programme.title: Shetland
programme.desc: Olivia has almost given up hope of ever finding her daughter, and Perez tries to reassure her when some terrible news reaches them. Perez and Tosh arrive at Spiggie Beach to see body bags lined up in a row on the sand. They guess that the people were the next shipment being trafficked to the islands, and when the traffickers realised their operation had been compromised, they abandoned them at sea. Piecing the case together, Perez closes in on Zezis location, but can he reach her before its too late?

programme.title: Joanna Lumleys Home Sweet Home - Travels in My Own Land
programme.desc: Starting in the Outer Hebrides, Joanna explores the Harris tweed industry, and drives a herd of Highland cattle across the sands at low tide to their winter grazing. Next she heads to Eilean Donan Castle, the location for her first episode of The New Avengers. Crossing to Northern Ireland, Joanna visits the Dark Hedges, made famous in Game of Thrones, before having a laugh with one of the Derry Girls. She then meets the inspiring founder of the Children in Crossfire charity

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The latest competition begins at No 33 Hunstanton in Norfolk, where owner Janie Thompson and housekeeper Gemma Layfield hope their quirky design and high-end brand of luxury will win the day. Despite the decor, the in-room bath receives a soggy reception from Cheryle and Anthony Katz, owners of The Lansdowne in the Cotswolds. An afternoon of painting sees Mark and Jan Rummery from The Ivybridge in Goodwick, Wales, emerge as the ones to beat and the groups banter begins. At dinner, father-and-son duo Mick and Chris Emanuele from La Tavola Calda in Nuneaton reveal that theyre BandB old-timers and their Italian roots pique interest

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to La Tavola Calda in Nuneaton, where father-and-son team Mick and Chris Emanuele run a basic BandB above their Italian restaurant. On arrival, Mark and Jan are horrified by the standard of decor. That evening, Mick and Chris reveal their George Michael tribute act will be performing after dinner. Janie and Gemma love the experience, but the noise in the rooms keeps Jan awake

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the Lansdowne in the Cotswolds, where hosts Cheryle and Anthony Katz hope their hospitality expertise will charm their way to the top. Although the rooms are a hit for Janie and Gemma, Mick and Chris are determined to find fault. Mark and Jan reveal a competitive streak during an afternoon of husky racing, and come dinner Anthony and Cheryle have their business credentials scrutinised

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to the Ivybridge Hotel and Spa in Fishguard Bay, Pembrokeshire, where Mark and Jan Rummery have brought their hospitality experience in Asia to Wales. On arrival, Cheryle and Anthony are unimpressed to be housed in an annexe, and Mick and Chris dismiss the bathroom as a bodge job. During an afternoon of Chinese cookery, the tensions are palpable as relationships continue to disintegrate

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The BandB owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and to thrash out their issues. No 33 Hunstanton is up first, as hosts Janie and Gemma quiz Mark and Jan over their privacy problems. Next, father and son duo Mick and Chris Emanuele from La Tavola Calda want to put Cheryle and Anthonys sleep issues to bed. Eventually, matters are resolved and the winner is announced

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend delve into unknown territory when they transform Charlies beloved Lexus IS200 into a full-blown competition drift car

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend restore Adams Datsun 240k Skyline, an extremely rare Japanese classic from the 1970s. In fact, with only two others on the road, its the rarest car theyve ever taken on

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer scour the south coast between Southampton and Bognor Regis, where both the tide and the pressure to find properties are running high. Kirsties couple, Antoinette and Matt, have been renting in Southampton for three years, paying more than £30,000 in the process. They want their money to go into a home they own instead, but their search has been stalled by unsuccessful offers. Theyre looking for a four-bedroom house with a garden and a living room big enough for two televisions so the pair can enjoy their separate hobbies together. One particular property really hits the mark, but with other interested parties Kirstie must draw on her years of experience to ensure Antoinette and Matt arent pipped at the post yet again. Meanwhile, Phil is searching in and around charming Chichester with Catherine, who wants a fresh start following the end of her marriage. Three-bedrooms and a short commute to work are priorities, but that narrows the pool of potential properties. Phil tries a couple of curve balls, but ultimately location wins out over size and Catherine finds a house she thinks is the one

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: The dynamic property duo catch up with two sets of house-hunters who wanted to make the switch from London life to family life. In 2016, Cara and Ben realised that in order to have the space they wanted theyd need to move out of the capital. Keen cyclist Ben discovered Bishops Stortford when he was out on a bike ride, and the couple moved into a rental property there so that they could get a feel for the town before they bought. With the surprise arrival of baby Max, and their rental lease about to end, they were desperate to buy a place of their own. Phil showed them just what they were looking for, and as fate would have it, just around the corner from their rental. Kirstie and Phil catch up with Cara and Ben to find that theyve expanded to a family of four and the house has had a serious makeover. In 2020, Tom and his Floridian wife Kaitlyn were still house sharing with Toms old schoolfriend in south London. Desperate to find their own pad to start a family in and even with a healthy budget of £450k, the couple had been struggling to find everything on their wish list: three bedrooms, character, lots of outside space for keen gardener Tom, and the American-style large open-plan living space that Kaitlyn was used to. Even with Kirstie and Phil onside, none of the properties they saw hit enough of their marks to make the couple want to offer, so Phil advised them to expand their search area further east into Kent. Now, Phils back to see how theyre getting on

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of 37-year-old Angelo Mastropietro, as he transforms a damp, dark and abandoned cave in Worcestershire. Having recently been diagnosed with multiple sclerosis, Angelo wants to create a retreat to help him cope with the news and become a 21st-century caveman. He has a budget of £100,000 and plans to almost single-handedly carve, cut and drill into the hillside to make the cave comfortable for contemporary living. However, there is no manual for a project of this kind, and the unique challenge soon becomes an obsession

programme.title: Inspector Gerri
programme.sub-title: A Promise Is a Debt - Part One
programme.desc: A young woman is found murdered in her home. Initial suspicions focus on her partner, who had been abusing her for some time and is on the run. The couples children are placed in a childrens residential facility, while the police discover that others had motives for wanting to get rid of her. And in his personal quest, Gerri is trying to find Tano, an older boy who was kind to him when he was a child. In Italian

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Young parents Nicole and Stefian arrive in resus with their 19-month-old daughter XahNae, who is unresponsive and has a high fever, and doctors fear she may have a life-threatening infection. Meanwhile, the team suspects 61-year-old Christine has suffered a second stroke in 10 years, and 52-year-old Graham, who has Downs syndrome, is brought into AandE by his sisters following an accident

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Bill, 92, arrives at Kings with breathing difficulties and a swollen leg and test results suggest there may be something seriously wrong, while 25-year-old Sarah is finding it hard to stand up and has been brought in by her mum and grandfather. She has learning difficulties as a result of an inherited genetic disorder and doctors are concerned she may have suffered a stroke

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A woman falls getting off a bus and badly cuts her leg, and a pharmacist calls 999, worried that a childs rash could be a sign of meningitis. A holiday ends abruptly when a cut to a mans arm wont stop bleeding. A woman with cerebral palsy cant walk and needs medical help, and a man has a heart rate so low he could go into cardiac arrest at any moment

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Young parents Nicole and Stefian arrive in resus with their 19-month-old daughter XahNae, who is unresponsive and has a high fever, and doctors fear she may have a life-threatening infection. Meanwhile, the team suspects 61-year-old Christine has suffered a second stroke in 10 years, and 52-year-old Graham, who has Downs syndrome, is brought into AandE by his sisters following an accident

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Bill, 92, arrives at Kings with breathing difficulties and a swollen leg and test results suggest there may be something seriously wrong, while 25-year-old Sarah is finding it hard to stand up and has been brought in by her mum and grandfather. She has learning difficulties as a result of an inherited genetic disorder and doctors are concerned she may have suffered a stroke

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty visits Sri Lanka to reveal the extraordinary lengths to which manufacturers go in order to split red lentils, and asks why they bother with this process. Kate Quilton learns why the way tea is drunk can affect its taste, and Matt Tebbutt finds out the difference between bubblegum and chewing gum

programme.title: Ugly House to Lovely House with George Clarke
programme.desc: George meets Amin and Amifa, whose 1920s house in Bellingham, south east London, is not just ugly - the propertys DIY extension added by former owners has been condemned. The makeshift kitchen is an accident waiting to happen. The living room is dark and dingy and misaligned windows are not doing anything for its kerb appeal. Enter architect Carl Turner, who has a modest budget of £80,000 to transform this monstrosity. Can he create a contemporary, spacious and adaptable home for this rapidly growing family?

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.sub-title: Ambulance Ski Chalet and Oil Rig Lifeboat
programme.desc: Architect George Clarke meets Kay from Stockport, Greater Manchester, who breathes life back into an ambulance as she turns it into a ski chalet on wheels. An oil rig lifeboat owner tries to get his build shipshape and plush enough to convince his partner to move on board. Plus, George and contributor Will Hardie indulge in a slice of Africa in the Midlands, and Will visits an awe-inspiring Thomas Heatherwick building in Leeds that puts nature at its very heart

programme.title: George Clarkes Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George Clarke helps more people make their period homes fit for modern life. On a cobbled street in Cheshire sits a Georgian town house that could be straight out of a Dickens novel. It may look very 18th-century on the outside, but inside George discovers that its a 1980s horror show, having been stripped of its original features. It does have one unique feature, though - a first-floor conservatory on stilts. Can he find a way of getting its grandeur back? George also has his work cut out tackling a 380-year-old Jacobean cottage

programme.title: Love It or List It New Zealand
programme.desc: Hayley and Craig Monk live in Devonport, a suburb with a seaside-holiday feeling, just across the harbour from central Auckland. Built by Craigs grandfather, the Monks solid brick and tile home has housed four generations of their family. When Craig and Hayley moved in, the house had been largely untouched since the 1950s. But its old-school layout disconnects the family - including their two young sons - and almost ignores the large, sunny back garden. Alexs saving grace is a very healthy renovation budget. But shell need every cent to turn this house into a modern home that flows. And halfway through the renovation, a spanner in the works alters everything that Alex has planned. Paul is feeling confident when Hayley and Craig reveal their budget for the property search, which may be enough to find them the perfect, modern family home. Will the Monks decide to love their home or list it?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in Broughty Ferry, Dundee, at The Abertay Guest House, where hosts Kate and Karlos Victor hope that their home-from-home approach will win the day. On arrival, Bob Calder and his sister-in-law Kirsty Laird, who run the Registry Guest House near Aberdeen, immediately want to leave. The group get to try their hand at the sport of curling, but despite the ice, the competition heats up for Jules Tagger and his partner Jan Latimer, from the Wellwood in Amble. At dinner, the disagreements continue as Pauline and Mike Hirst from the Albert in Scarborough get political over Kates views on Scotland

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Chef Jules Tagger and his partner Jan Latimer finish the week at the Wellwood in Amble, Northumberland, but Kate and Karlos think there are some serious faults to address

programme.desc: Beautician Claire hosts the third dinner party in Cardiff, but her decision to serve her favourite dishes on planks instead of plates proves controversial

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Part-time football referee Scott serves up a menu of family favourites in Cardiff, but might have scored an own goal by putting cheese in every course

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This weeks competition kicks off in Dorset, at 17th-century country inn the Fox and Hounds, where creased bedding and unwrapped biscuits leave the guests unhappy

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The BandBers head to The Lord Bute in Dorset for the weeks third visit, where former Mayfair chef Bradley and his right-hand man Ryan are exasperated at breakfast
