programme.desc: Pauline Scanlon and Aoife Ní Bhriain celebrate the music and ancient culture of Fingal from the Irish Institute of Music and Song in Balbriggan. For Aoife, its a happy homecoming to her native county, as she performs with her father, legendary piper Mick OBrien. A lively night of music sees the great Leslie Dowdall join our hosts on-stage, while dance troupe ProdiJIG, rapper JyellowL and balladeers Sean Fitzgerald and Daragh Lynch head an eclectic line-up. Eventually, a university professor persuades him to see a psychologist, who befriends him and proves the only person able to help him come to terms with his talent and past traumas. Drama, written by and starring Matt Damon and Ben Affleck, who won Oscars for their screenplay. With Robin Williams, Minnie Driver and Stellan Skarsgard

programme.title: Elvis - The 1968 Comeback Special
programme.desc: The singers classic TV special, which saw him make a return to live performance after more than eight years away, with the show featuring an array of musical set-pieces, including a jam session with his old backing band and a mini-musical. Songs include Heartbreak Hotel, Hound Dog, All Shook Up, Jailhouse Rock, Dont Be Cruel, Love Me Tender, Trouble, Cant Help Falling in Love and Gospel Medley

programme.title: Laochra Gael
programme.desc: A sometimes cruel and intense rivalry in the All Ireland Championship of the late Eighties and early Nineties saw two great hurling sides, Galway and Tipperary, as regular opponents. This film looks at the rivalry between them from 1987 to 1991. Contributors include Michael (Babs) Keating, Cyril Farrell, Pete Finnerty, Joe Connolly, Pat Fox, and Joe Hayes

programme.title: Nuacht TG4
programme.desc: The days main news stories from a regional, national and international perspective.

programme.title: Celtic Connections 2022
programme.desc: Music show filmed during Celtic Connections in Glasgow, presented by musician and broadcaster Donal OConnor, who welcomes a diverse musical cast, including popular powerhouse duo, Breanndán OBeaglaíoch and Tim Edey. The Orcadian band Fara play music that has won them a solid fanbase. Donal is joined by a bona fide supergroup, Scottish music legends, Frets: Norman Blake, James Grant and Monica Queen. Theres a dazzling musical showcase from celebrated and world-renowned musician Brian Finnegan, who brings an outstanding band to Glasgow

programme.title: Scealta na gCorn
programme.desc: Gráinne McElwain visits the rebel county of Cork, All Ireland winners in football, hurling and camogie across the decades. A county steeped in history, Gráinne is keen to find out about some of the silverware that honour patriots such as John Flyer Nyhan and his deep connection with the War of Independence and former Cork Lord Mayors Tomás Mac Curtain and Terence McSwiney. She also hears about the trophies named in honour of some of the countys influential women in football, such as Mary Quinn and a curiously named cup called Little Norah

programme.title: Comhrá
programme.desc: Bairbre Uí Mhiuilia, the 93-year-old mother of rugby player Mick Molloy, talks about her first teaching job in Inis Bearracháin, off the coast of Co Galway

programme.title: Seal le Dáithí
programme.desc: Dáithí Ó Se is joined by guest Aoife Scott. Born into the legendary Black Family, Aoife is steadily rising to the top of the traditional and folk music scene. Aoifes single All Along the Wild Atlantic Way hit the number one slot, knocking Ed Sheeran off the top spot and was named Song of the Year at the Irish Folk Music Awards in 2017

programme.title: Will and Ralf Should Know Better
programme.desc: Will Mellor and Ralf Little have been friends for over 20 years - the world has changed a lot since they first met and so have they. This documentary series sees them embark on a mission to discover what aspects of modern life they are getting right but more often are getting wrong. Travelling the length and breadth of the UK behind the wheel of an electric car, Will and Ralf laugh, cry and learn more about themselves and each other in a few weeks than they ever have in two decades of friendship. Along the way, they meet a series of extraordinary characters, explore unexpected worlds, and push themselves well out of their comfort zones. Whether trying to impress the World’s Strongest Woman with their strength, talking to nettles in an eco-village, living like Stone Age cavemen or stripping naked in front of 1,000 women, Will and Ralf challenge themselves and each other to learn new things and to push themselves to do and be better. Along the way, stuck in the car for hours with only a satnav and a bespoke playlist to distract them, they bond not just through reminiscing about the good old days and indulging in in-car karaoke, but also through talking about where they are now as middle-aged men and opening up to each other

programme.desc: A school camp takes a deadly turn when a teacher is found swinging lifelessly from a zipline - apparently poisoned before the ride began. After the victims past reveals a web of uneasy alliances and rivalries, Detective Shepherd must cipher through a long list of suspects. Drama, starring Neill Rea, Fern Sutherland and Jarod Rawiri

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg persuades Compo and Blamire to buy a car so they can get around more easily, but the old banger they end up with turns out to be more trouble than it is worth

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Inspired by a local art event, Blamire, Compo and Clegg decide to go camping and take some creative photographs of anything that interests them. Michael Bates, Bill Owen and Peter Sallis star

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Ted has a chance of stardom when he is hired as a late replacement at an uptown show for a fellow comedian. programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Betting fever sweeps Slade Prison, but the stakes rise too high for some of the inmates, stretching honour among thieves to the limit. Vintage comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The residents are troubled by a bicycle, and Compos lucky rabbits foot causes even more problems, while Sid tries his best to avoid Ivy. Peter Sallis, Bill Owen and Michael Bates star in the long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, from the pen of Roy Clarke

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Whos That Dancing with Nora Batty, Then?

programme.title: Dads Army
programme.desc: Captain Mainwaring organises a dance in an attempt to boost platoon morale - but Pike interrupts proceedings to make an important announcement regarding his girlfriend Violet. Classic comedy by Jimmy Perry and David Croft, starring Ian Lavender. First broadcast in 1969

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: In the first episode of the classic sitcom, beleaguered and badgered hotelier Basil Fawlty tries to attract a better class of clientele, but ends up being taken to the cleaners by the first seemingly upper-crust customer to check in. Starring John Cleese, Prunella Scales, Andrew Sachs and Connie Booth

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: Basils belief that guests are an obstacle to the smooth running of his hotel is borne out by the arrival of an aggressive woman (Joan Sanderson), and the tension between the two leads to a series of increasingly heated arguments. Classic comedy, starring John Cleese, Prunella Scales, Andrew Sachs and Connie Booth

programme.title: Fawlty Towers: The Play
programme.desc: Recorded at the original West End production based on the beloved comedy series, this special brings together three iconic episodes into a single theatrical experience

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: A loud-mouthed, abrasive American comes to stay at the hotel and soon exposes Basils ignorance of transatlantic cuisine - particularly Waldorf salad. Classic comedy, starring John Cleese, Prunella Scales and Andrew Sachs

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: The hotel is plunged into chaos by the death of a guest, leading to all manner of mayhem as Basil tries to conceal the corpse from the other occupants. Classic comedy, guest starring Geoffrey Palmer, with John Cleese and Prunella Scales

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: Mischievous Basil pretends he has forgotten about his 15th wedding anniversary - but Sybil responds by walking out on him. With friends due to arrive for a celebratory party, the harassed hotelier is forced to take desperate steps to convince them all is well on the marital front. Guest starring Una Stubbs and Ken Campbell

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: Manuels pet rat escapes just as a health inspector is about to pay a fact-finding visit, sending Basil on a mad dash to track it down before disaster ensues. Madcap comedy, starring John Cleese, Prunella Scales and Andrew Sachs

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del gets the chance to sell off a couple of antique urns - the only problem being that one of them contains the ashes of Triggers late grandfather. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst, Lennard Pearce and Roger Lloyd Pack

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del takes up cards in his latest bid to make his first million - much to the annoyance of Rodney and Grandad, who reckon he will end up gambling away all their worldly goods. Comedy with the wheeler-dealing Trotter family, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del-Boy cannot believe his ears when Rodney tells him he has found a girlfriend. The trouble is, the woman is old enough to be his mother - and to make matters worse, her husband is about to be released from prison

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del jumps at the opportunity to decorate the local Chinese restaurant to make a quick profit, and the results are outstanding in more ways than one. Comedy, with David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del and Rodney reluctantly agree to let Grandad accompany them on their holiday abroad - a decision they come to regret. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce

programme.title: Almas Not Normal
programme.desc: After a recent break-up, Alma tries to get her life back on track, but with no job, no qualifications and a rebellious streak a mile wide, it is not going to be easy. Meanwhile, her heroin-addicted mother has been sectioned for arson, and her grandmother Joan wants nothing to do with it. Comedy pilot, written by and starring Sophie Willan

programme.title: Almas Not Normal
programme.desc: Almas dream of becoming an actress isnt going to be easy and she needs to find a day job. After unsuccessfully dipping her toe into the world of escorting, she reluctantly takes up a position at a sandwich shop. Comedy, written by and starring Sophie Willan

programme.title: Almas Not Normal
programme.desc: Alma treats best friend Leanne to a shopping spree, during which she discovers Bolton Acting School and decides to join up. She also arranges another family meeting between Lin and Joan at an upmarket restaurant, but its not to everybodys taste. Comedy, starring Sophie Willan

programme.title: Men Behaving Badly
programme.desc: First-ever episode of the comedy. Gary and Dermot worry about who will moving into the newly vacant flat above them, but their fears prove unfounded when it turns out to be an attractive blonde

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Two strong-willed first-time mothers give birth at Leeds General Infirmary. Alexandra is 25 and left her native Latvia in search of adventure. She believes her child is the missing piece in her life, even though the father is not around anymore. Surbhi is from a warrior Hindu caste and knows what she wants, while her husband will do anything to please her, especially as he feels responsible for a motorcycle accident that left his wife paralysed in one arm

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: Mark and Karen are emotionally attached to their charming and one-of-a-kind 1940s home, but they could do without its more mysterious and dysfunctional quirks

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: A former cowboy and his family love their vintage ranch house, but the awkward layout, dated yellow kitchen and unsafe fireplace need a lot of help.

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Dartford to meet Scott and Jenny, whose third son Charlie was born with cerebral palsy and developmental delay. The boy needs round-the-clock care, which his mother gave up work to provide, but now he is 13, the family are struggling to cope in their small home. Having heard of their plight, the DIY SOS team turns up to transform their end terrace, backed up by an army of local tradespeople, with designer Naomi Cleaver on hand to ensure they dont stray too far from her vision

programme.title: MasterChef Australia
programme.desc: Curtis Stone returns for the second night in a row and sets up the ultimate challenge: to create a winter warmer ice-cream and pair it with a dessert

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: The paramedics of the West Midlands Ambulance Service attend to a man with abdominal pain, and a grandmother suffering a panic attack

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: The team races to save an injured woman trapped in a van crushed between two lorries

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: Featuring a stand-off involving a man wielding a samurai sword in South Yorkshire

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: Paramedics save a person having a massive heart attack, a patients lung is in danger of collapsing after a car crash, and an injured cyclist is winched to safety

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: A routine winch job becomes a life-and-death situation on the Queen Charlotte Track, and a rescue our first responders will never forget

programme.title: Joe Wicks: Facing My Childhood
programme.desc: Joe Wicks goes on an emotional journey to discover how his parents mental health issues affected him as a child and the shocking scale of the problem today. Joe meets members of Our Time, the UKs only charity dedicated to working with children of parents with mental illness, and has honest and emotional conversations with his family that unearth long-suppressed memories

programme.title: Amanda and Alans Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr take on their first project - designing a Sicilian kitchen. Kicking off the demolition in 36-degree heat proves to be a trial for Alan, and he soon realises that taking on a build in a medieval hilltop town comes with its own unique challenges. With the help of Project Manager Scott, Amanda barters with the locals at a nearby marble factory as she bags a bargain for their feature island and brushes up on her culinary skills in Marsala, learning how to cook Sicilys signature dish

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A murder hunt is launched when Reshnas body is pulled out of the Thames and evidence emerges that she was having an affair with a fellow student. Meanwhile, Diane and Mickey are left in the dark when an eccentric mugging victim claims to be an undercover officer and Scotland Yard refuse to confirm or deny her story. Jenny Eclair stars

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Emma is feeling raw after her marital difficulties boiled over into violence and shows her tough side to new recruit Beth Green (former EastEnder Louisa Lytton) as they investigate a womans claim her baby has been stolen. Jack is anxious to prove hes a worthy DCI and agrees to go undercover with Sam to get a lead on the illegal baby-selling business, but his mistake puts the DI in danger

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Will and Nikki investigate the suspicious death of a child protection officer on the Cheetham estate. New recruit Beth delivers her first caution following an affray between a car salesman and a woman protesting against the dangers of 4x4 vehicles, but theres more to the conflict than first meets the eye. Boothby Graffoe guest stars

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Nikki coaxes a potential suicide down from a factory building and urges him to give information on the child pornography ring he has been invited to join. Reg and Phil are called to a funeral home where a valuable necklace has been taken from a corpse in a sealed coffin. Siobhan Redmond guest stars as Scene of Crime Officer Lorna Hart

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Phils spell in uniform comes to a triumphant end when he borrows a bike to chase a mugger and recovers £15,000 in cash. The case gets more interesting when the victim admits hes being blackmailed. Heaton reassures terrified prosecution witness Martin Turnbull he will be given protection following threats from Ray Moore, only to discover the villainous ex-cop has subtler ways of intimidating people

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: Operations supervisor Gemma races to the scene of a life-threatening chainsaw accident. A woman is injured after falling on a hiking trail

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: Advanced care paramedics Ben and Rachel respond to a suspected heroin overdose. An elderly woman needs assistance after suffering a fall at home

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: Senior operations supervisor Dan treats a man with a gunshot wound. A young drunk-driver is injured after crashing into a parked car

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: The Queensland Ambulance Service respond to a motorbike crash. The patient is in good spirits despite suffering a serious injury to his left leg

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.desc: Pete meets a puppy who needs urgent treatment for a badly broken leg and a young Doberman who has spent most of her life in quarantine kennels

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.desc: Pete travels to Northern Ireland to pick up three stray dogs and bring them back to Essex. He also meets a Shar Pei who is in constant pain and may need surgery

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: In a One Born Every Minute special, cameras follow four couples through their multiple pregnancies and births. Ana and Paul are thrilled at the prospect of becoming first-time parents to triplets, but receive worrying news at a routine scan, while Beth has to have emergency laser surgery in her womb after her babies are diagnosed with twin-to-twin transfusion syndrome. Carolyne and Gordon, already parents to four children, are shocked to discover they can expect three more, while Sophie and Carlos try to cope with the premature arrival of their two daughters

programme.title: One Born: What Happened Next?
programme.desc: Three couples who have featured on the programme share their experiences of parenthood 12 months after they originally took part. A woman explains why it will not be easy for her partner to cope with looking after their child when she returns to work, and another couple voice their concerns about the effect that starting a family has had on their health. Meanwhile, Lucy seeks her husbands approval as she decides to resume her career as an opera singer

programme.title: Nurses on the Ward
programme.desc: At Queen Alexandra Hospital in Portsmouth, an engaging, funny and dedicated team of nurses reveal the realities of life on the ward. Paediatric nurse Mahbuba treats a girl with a brain tumour

programme.title: Nurses on the Ward
programme.desc: Paediatric nurse Mahbuba deals with a baby who cant breathe, while Rebecca treats a deaf cardiac patient and military nurse Scott cares for a struggling asthmatic

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: Ten aspiring designers compete in a commercial design challenge to redesign Oxfordshire show homes, with judge Michelle Ogundehin assessing their efforts with the help of guest Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen

programme.title: Amanda and Alans Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr set about renovating the bathrooms. Amanda is unconvinced about Alans bidet and Alan tries to veto Amandas disco ball installation - but neither will back down on their vision. In Alans quest to stay true to Sicilian culture, he treats Amanda to a visit to Marsalas salt pans for a unique spa experience. Amandas dreams of a roll-top bath come crashing down as Alan sets her the task of recycling the apartments existing one, but karma kicks in as his DIY skills are pushed to the limit with a masterclass in floor tiling

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his Bradshaws guide, Michael Portillo reaches Birmingham and discovers how a radical reformer made his mark on the city of a thousand trades. At Highbury Hall, he finds Joseph Chamberlains mansion home and hears how he established a political dynasty including a prime minister and a foreign secretary. Next stop is Cradley Heath, once one of five chain-making towns in the West Midlands. At the centre of Britains ceramic industry in Stoke-on-Trent, Michael visits Wedgwood, established by Queens Potter Josiah Wedgwood in 1759 and visited in 1913 by King George V and Queen Mary

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets off on the first leg of a journey across Northern Ireland to Argyll and Bute. Beginning in Newry, he finds a specially chartered train that would deliver demonstrators campaigning for Irish Home Rule to a rally in the town. On the border between Northern Ireland and the Republic at Glaslough, Michael discovers a christening robe belonging to Sir Winston Churchill

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Belfast to Portrush, he investigates the work of author and Narnia creator CS Lewis and learns how religion influenced Lewiss work. Michael also visits the Royal Portrush Golf Club to find out how Irelands female population dominated the fairways at the time of his guide

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey from Northern Ireland across the water to Scotland. Leaving from the seaport of Larne, he reaches Stranraer and the Mull of Galloway, where in a lighthouse built by railway engineer Robert Stevenson he discovers a magnificent machine, installed at the turn of the 20th-century

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek inspects a brace of old cop cars including a Rover P6 complete with radio, sirens and V8 engine, and a former Mod waves ciao to his collection of 1960s Italian scooters

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek swaps the office for rain-soaked Ripon to pick up a 1965 Ford Anglia with just 33,000 miles on the clock, while Daves loving the clean lines of a rare Renault Caravalle

programme.title: Rise of the Nazis
programme.desc: In January 1942 the German army lost the battle for Moscow and a furious Hitler sacked or side-lined his leading generals and appointed himself commander-in-chief of the army. He decided on a bold new plan, focusing his forces on seizing the Soviet oil fields and taking the fuel to supply his own troops. Stalin unveiled his own plan to drive the Germans out of the Soviet Union by launching a huge offensive from Leningrad to the Black Sea. Georgy Zhukov warned him that the Red Army was in no shape to attack, but Stalin banished the former chief of the general staff to the front and took control

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: A team of engineers fight to return a veteran Westland Wessex helicopter to the skies - 30 years after its last flight

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team return to Tredegar House near Newport. Among the finds are a locket that was a gift from Queen Victoria, a device used for creating tattoos, a classic car, a cigar cutter commemorating the opening of the Newport transporter bridge, 19th-century advertisements for public executions, a versatile tiara and a miniature font with a sad history

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit Hillsborough Castle in Northern Ireland and Ashton Court in Bristol. programme.desc: Simon travels through some of the most remote landscapes on Earth. programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Industrial Age
programme.desc: The former steeplejack sets out on an enthusiastic tour of Britains industrial heritage, exploring the early use of wind and water power and visiting some steam engines still in use today. programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Industrial Age

programme.desc: The former steeplejack examines the history of the iron and steel industries, beginning with a visit to Ironbridge Gorge in Shropshire. programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: When the remains of a teenager are found half-buried in a wood, Vera finds herself investigating a 30-year-old mystery. Identified as Carrie Telling, a girl who disappeared during the 1984 miners strike, the team retrieves news footage from the protests that shows her taking pictures in the background. It appears she got caught up in the unrest that day, contradicting her fathers assertion that she went straight home. Photographs recovered from her camera yield further revelations for Vera. What did Carrie discover that ultimately led to her death?

programme.title: Dancing on Ice

Ashley Banjo and Oti Mabuse complete the judging line up

Husband-and-wife team Richard and Lorna then face the Limitless Ladder looking to win some major money - theyve been doing some proper homework, but can they translate it into hard cash?

Ben Shephard gives the celebrities a chance to claim up to £20,000 for their charity of choice by dropping tokens down four chutes, in the hope of knocking piles off a moving shelf. The more tokens they collect, the better their chances of collecting the cash prize

They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

Rob Beckett, Zoe Ball and Eddie Kadi are the members of the celebrity panel predicting if the challengers can complete the task with which they are faced

programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Another line-up of contestants answer questions that could change their lives - with lifelines, including Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend and 50-50 available to them if they get stuck. Jeremy Clarkson hosts

Also on the guest list are British boxing champion-turned-Strictly contestant Nicola Adams and actors Josh OConnor and Emma Corrin, who are playing the roles of Charles and Diana in the new season of The Crown

programme.desc: Stories from inside University Hospital Limerick, a hospital that had been called unsafe and a death trap

With a price tag of over two million pounds, Dan has to hope that his little black book of contacts can help him get the deal across the line

programme.title: Heartbeat

Kersey ventures up onto the moors to investigate and does not return - so Wycliffe is forced to go it alone. Jack Shepherd and Jimmy Yuill star

programme.desc: Aggie MacKenzie meets a man whose fathers PoW Japanese suitcase reveals a fascinating wartime past, and another who is about to unknowingly throw away the most noteworthy item from his clutter-filled garage

programme.title: The Salvage Squad
programme.desc: Brian Dowling and his fashion-forward design team continue their mission to prove to the nation that it is possible achieve a dream renovation at little cost. Changing Rooms meets the Repair Shop with a new sustainable twist, the challenge here is to transform our bland old rooms, furniture and fittings into unique and stunning show stoppers, using only upcycling and sustainable methods. This is the home makeover format for the world we live in today, as two households per week, each with a team consisting of an interior designer and an up-cycling wiz, have just four days and 1,000 euro to renovate and rejuvenate a tired spaces in their home, filling them with home-made, re-used and revamped furnishings. Two families are selected from the same region each week and each has a tired room in need of renovation and re-imagining containing a potential treasure trove of up-cycling gems

Fanning the flames of envy and hatred, psychic aunt Kathy Cloade reveals the grieving widows first husband is in fact still alive, and a second death prompts Poirot to delve deeper into the familys dark secrets. programme.desc: Ranvir Singh and Kunle Barker travel to Tamworth to meet Keira and Ewan in their newly purchased 1960s home. With a tiny budget they have allocated £3,000 to renovate their bathroom, yet they want a luxury hotel look. Their green makeover involves replacing a water-guzzling toilet and bath with money- and energy-saving fittings as well as creating a chic and contemporary finish. For inspiration, Ranvir heads to a house with a wood-fired hot tub

programme.desc: Documentary revealing surprising stories of human-animal cohabitation in Japans capital, one of the worlds busiest cities

programme.desc: The comedian begins another tour of Zambia, Namibia and South Africa helping to hand-rear orphaned animals and prepare them for release back into their natural habitats. His first stop is the Moholoholo Wildlife Rehabilitation Centre, where he meets an eight-month-old rhino which lost its mother when she was killed by poachers. Next, he teaches a young aardvark how to hunt for termites, before providing some much-needed company for a lion cub which was raised as a pet until she got too big to handle

programme.desc: A shot rings out in an isolated farmhouse as a young man is killed by an unseen hand. Two weeks previously, four siblings return home to scatter their mothers ashes and read her will, little realising that this family reunion will end in murder. Thriller, starring Catherine Tyldesley, David Caves and Mali Jones

programme.title: Come Rain, Come Shine
programme.desc: Come Rain, Come Shine is a drama, centering on working-class ex-docker Don (Sir David Jason, A Touch of Frost). Family means everything to Don and he is fiercely proud of his wealthy son David, a property developer, whose flashy lifestyle is in sharp contrast to his parents simple and unpretentious life. When the economic crunch hits, the truth about Davids affluent life surfaces and facing financial ruin he moves back home. Don is determined to keep his family afloat, emotionally and financially, and in the process they all discover what is truly important to them in life.

programme.sub-title: St Patricks Athletic v Galway United
programme.desc: St Patricks Athletic v Galway United (Kick-off 7.45pm). All the action from the Premier Division match at Richmond Park. programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by guests Oscar-nominated British star Rosamund Pike, who discusses her new comedy thriller I Care a Lot. But if she manages to keep her identity intact, theyll be the ones pulling on the Marigolds. Presented by Brian McFadden

programme.desc: Sundays services grind to a halt when the 11.57 service to Penzance derails as it is departing, while a knife-carrying passenger causes concern in Bristol. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Whos Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Singer Jay Aston, best known as one quarter of 1981 Eurovision- winners Bucks Fizz, is todays VIP cook, providing a selection of dishes for a team of fitness fanatics who have to guess her identity. If the guests are successful, they will be one step closer to winning the full cash prize - but if they fail, they will be the ones doing the washing up. Hosted by Brian McFadden

programme.title: Hells Kitchen
programme.desc: The chefs must model their expertise and work in harmony to balance an array of ingredients and create a dish that really sings.

programme.desc: Coming-of-age drama. Jonny has moved to a new town, made a fresh start at a new college and has a whole new group of friends, but will they help him attract the attention of fellow new student Bex? Meanwhile, Naisha is cramping best friend Dylans style and Ella is devastated when an exposing video goes viral

programme.title: Autopsy USA
programme.desc: The death of singer and actress Debbie Reynolds, which occured the day after that of her daughter Carrie Fisher

programme.title: Inside China: The Battle for Tibet
programme.desc: Investigating the mystery of a missing boy, the 11th Panchen Lama, who was abducted by Beijing 30 years ago whose role now holds the key to the Dalai Lamas successor and to Tibets future. Using ground-breaking footage, testimony and interviews with recent Tibetan escapees, this documentary reveals the restrictions Tibetans face daily under Chinese President Xi Jinpings rule and sees how the unique culture of seven million Tibetans is being wiped away
